result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deandre L Johnson

records.addlTxt: Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing ( 12 pages) commencing 03-29-2022 by Amy De La Rosa.

Defendant Deandre L Johnson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney William Robert Kerner in court for Deandre L Johnson.  Attorney Annie Louk in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Final Pre-Trial. Parties remain in a jury trial posture. Final pretrial discussions held. Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on 11/07/2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed. Defendant's Statement on Witnesses
Received and Filed. Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions
State's Witness List.  Received and Filed.  nk
State's Motion in Limine.  Received and Filed. nk
State's Requested Jury Instruction.  Received and Filed.  nk

Attorney William Robert Kerner in court, defendant Deandre L Johnson not in court, in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Motion Hearing. Defendant not produced. Court addresses defense's motion to sever. No objections from the state. Court orders cases severed. Case remains calendared as previously set.
Received and Filed. STATE RESPONSE TO DEFENDANTS MOTION TO SEVER
Received and Filed. MOTION FOR MODIFICATION OF BRIEFING SCHEDULE
Motion to Sever Defendants for trial
Justice Point Violation Report forwarded to Judge for review and filed.

Attorney William Robert Kerner in court, defendant Deandre L Johnson not in court, in custody.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. All parties appeared via zoom. Defendant not produced. Defense counsel requests Motion Hearing and Jury Trial dates from the court. Discussion with parties put forth on the record. Court grants request and sets the following deadlines: 07/13/2022 deadline for filing the motion to sever. 07/27/2022 deadline for state's response. 10/24/2022 deadline for filing any trial documents. Case adjourned to Br 16. Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case will be heard in room 503 of the courthouse.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 11:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 6-8-22
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Violation Report 5-10-22

Defendant Deandre L Johnson in court with Attorney William Robert Kerner.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for arraignment.  The arraignment was held via zoom.
Filed, original information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty, and requests Status Conference hearing.  Defense has received discovery and the state's offer.  The matter is adjourned back to Branch 16 via zoom.

  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 4-19-22

Defendant Deandre L Johnson in court with attorney Adam Kerner on behalf of William Kerner.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #16cf1427. Sworn for the State: City of MKE Police Officer Mohammad Abdulghani. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Defense requests arraignment date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Arraignment scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 3-28-22
Received and Filed. Notice of Retainer

Adjustment Number: 22A 029276,
Payable Number: 995382,
Receipt Number: 22RP012320,
Amount: $20.00
22RM015287  Actual Date Bond Posted with *03/19/2022
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Violation Report 3-22-22

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Deandre L Johnson in court with attorney Kylie Kaltenberg.  Defendant Deandre L Johnson in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT WILL HIRE PRIVATE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
